profileText: (Son of George Kirkpatrick Denton), a Representative from Indiana; born in Evansville, Vanderburgh County, Ind., October 28, 1896; attended the public schools; attended De Pauw University, Greencastle, Ind.; A.B., De Pauw University, 1919; J.D., Harvard Law School, Cambridge, Mass., 1922; United States Army Air Corps, First World War, 1919; United States Army, Second World War, 1942-1945; lawyer, private practice; prosecuting attorney, Vanderburgh County, Ind., 1932-1936; member of the Indiana state legislature, 1937-1942, and as minority leader, 1941; member of the Indiana state budget committee, 1940-1942; elected as a Democrat to the Eighty-first and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 1949-January 3, 1953); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Eighty-third Congress in 1952; delegate to each Democratic National Convention, 1952 to 1964; elected to the Eighty-fourth and to the five succeeding Congresses and served until his resignation on December 30, 1966 (January 3, 1955-December 30, 1966); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Ninetieth Congress in 1966; died on November 2, 1971, in Evansville, Ind.; interment in Oak Hill Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1913-1971, 15 volumes and 18 boxes.
researchRecord.description: The collection of Winfield Denton chiefly contains congressional papers consisting of reports, correspondence, legislation introduced by Winfield Denton relating to veterans' benefits, aid to farmers, and flood control. Additional papers include correspondence, advertising, campaign material, political speeches and statements, pocket diaries, newsletters, radio broadcasts, statements issued for constituents, personal financial records, and scrapbooks. Winfield Denton's trips to Europe for NATO parliamentarians' conferences, and to the South Pacific on congressional business are documented, as well as legal cases handled with his father, a pilot's logbook, and military papers from World War I and World II. A finding aid is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Matthew E. Welsh Papers, 1941-1978, 79 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Wilfield K. Denton. A finding aid is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1894-1970, 52 boxes, 2 oversize boxes, and 9 bound volumes.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Winfield K. Denton contain personal, legal, political, and congressional papers, newsclippings, scrapbooks, and photographs. Personal papers include financial and military materials, and the papers of George K. Denton. Legal papers include materials concerning major cases, including the Posey T. Kime estate, and cases against Guardian Life and John Hancock insurance companies, Wasson Coal Mining Corp. of Boonsville, Ind., and Cavalier Garment Corp. of Evansville, Indiana. The papers also contain records from the Vanderburgh County Tax Adjustment Board. Political papers deal with Winfield Denton's congressional campaigns and service. Topics consist of U.S. Service academy applications, the Army Corps of Engineers' waterway and flood control projects, the New Harmony toll bridge, the George Rogers Clark Memorial, congressional committee trips, and Winfield Denton's terms as a NATO parliamentarian. Newsclippings and scrapbooks cover congressional campaigns and issues. Photographs are of Winfield Denton's personal, military, and congressional activities, including images of U.S. presidents, Indiana politicians, congressional trips, flood sites in Indiana, and the submarine U.S.S. Nautilus. A guide to the collection is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: 1966, 2 commercials on 1 film reel.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Winfield Denton's campaign for the 1966 U.S. congressional election in District 8 of Indiana, Democratic Party.
